alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:21PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Gilchrist, southwestern Columbia and Suwannee Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mcalpin to near Fort White. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Ichetucknee Spring, Columbia, Fort White, Wellborn, Obrien, Mcalpin, Branford, Hildreth and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
